briefTitle: Glucose Response of G-Pen (Glucagon Injection) in Pediatric T1D Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* diagnosed with T1D for at least 6 months at Screening.
* current usage of daily insulin treatment.

Exclusion Criteria:

* pregnant or nursing
* renal insufficiency
* hepatic synthetic insufficiency
* aspartate or alanine aminotransferase \> 3 times the upper limit of normal
* hematocrit less than or equal to 30%
* use of \> 2.0 U/kg total insulin dose per day
* inadequate venous access
* current seizure disorder
* history of pheochromocytoma or disorder with increased risk of pheochromocytoma
* history of insulinoma
* history of glycogen storage disease.
* active use of alcohol or drugs of abuse
* administration of glucagon within 14 days of the first treatment visit
* participation in other studies involving an investigational drug or device within 30 days

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Plasma Glucose
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary endpoint for this study is an evaluation of change in plasma glucose following treatment with G-Pen, with an emphasis on the increase from baseline to 30 minutes post-dosing.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time for Plasma Glucose to Increase by ≥25 mg/dL
outcomeMeasures.description: Time for plasma glucose to increase by ≥25 mg/dL from baseline will be analyzed descriptively for each age cohort.

outcomeMeasures.title: Plasma Glucagon Area Under the Curve
outcomeMeasures.description: Plasma glucagon area under the curve (AUC) for each age cohort will be analyzed descriptively.

outcomeMeasures.title: Plasma Glucagon Cmax
outcomeMeasures.description: Plasma glucagon maximum concentration for each age cohort will be analyzed descriptively.

outcomeMeasures.title: Plasma Glucagon Tmax
outcomeMeasures.description: Plasma glucagon time to maximum concentration for each age cohort will be analyzed descriptively.
